title: Optional try
question: Which of these are true about throwing functions?
hint: Many people call ! the crash operator because it might crash your app, and it's no different with try!.

correct.answer: If you use try you must either catch the error or mark your function as throws
Using try? converts a function's return value into an optional.
If you use try! and your call throws an error, your code crashes.
When using try you must catch all errors that can be thrown.
Functions that throw errors must be marked throws.

wrong.answer: You can use try?! to combine try? and try!
wrong.reason: This does not exist in Swift.

wrong.answer: If you use try? and your call throws an error, your code crashes.
wrong.reason: If the calls throws an error you'll get back nil.

wrong.answer: If you use try and know your function won't throw errors, you don't need to catch anything.
wrong.reason: Swift will force you to catch all errors.

wrong.answer: Functions that might throw errors must be marked throws?
Throwing functions must never call other throwing functions.
wrong.reason: They can call other functions freely, throwing or otherwise.

wrong.answer: Throwing functions can throw multiple errors using tuples.
wrong.reason: We must throw exactly one error at a time.
